t: For*pn Zion’s sake I will not keep silent, and*ld for Jerusalem’s sake I will not be quiet, until*ln her righteousness goes forth as brightness, and*ld her salvation as a burning torch.
The*ln nations shall see your righteousness, and*ld all the kings your glory, and*ln you shall be called by a new name that*ld the mouth of the Lord*s will give.
You*ln shall be a crown of beauty in the hand of the Lord,*s and*ld a royal diadem in the hand of your God.

You*ln shall no more be termed Forsaken, and*ld your land shall no more be termed Desolate, but*ln you shall be called My Delight Is in Her, and*ld your land Married; for*ln the Lord*s delights in you, and*ld your land shall be married.
For*ln as a young man marries a young woman, so*ld shall your sons marry you, and*ln as the bridegroom rejoices over the bride, so*ld shall your God rejoice over you.
On*pn your walls, O Jerusalem, I*ld have set watchmen; all*ln the day and all the night they*ld shall never be silent. You*ln who put the Lord*s in remembrance, take*ld no rest,
and*ln give him no rest until*ld he establishes Jerusalem and*ld makes it a praise in the earth.

The*ln Lord*s has sworn by his right hand and*ld by his mighty arm: “I*ln will not again give your grain to*ld be food for your enemies, and*ln foreigners shall not drink your wine for*ld which you have labored;
but*ln those who garner it shall eat it and*ld praise the Lord,*s and*ln those who gather it shall drink it in*ld the courts of my sanctuary.”
Go*pn through, go through the gates; prepare*ld the way for the people; build*ln up, build up the highway; clear*ld it of stones; lift*ld up a signal over the peoples.

Behold,*ln the Lord*s has proclaimed to*ld the end of the earth: Say*ln to the daughter of Zion, “Behold,*ld your salvation comes; behold,*ln his reward is with him, and*ld his recompense before him.”
And*ln they shall be called The Holy People, The*ld Redeemed of the Lord;*s and*ln you shall be called Sought Out, A*ld City Not Forsaken.
